> Mulled wine
Previous: Sultana porridge

Next: Asparagus bacon bundles
Mathematical and Physical Sciences Computer Literacy Statistics Cookbook Vocal
Desserts and breakfast Fish dish and sea bits Meat feast Pasta Risotto Salads and dips Soups to scoop Wraps and rolls Freezer inventory

Estimated time to read: 2 mins

Written by:

Reviewed by:

Published on: 30 Dec 2020

This is a quick and tasty treat. No chewing is required. Ideal during the winter, while curling up on the sofa under a blanket.

Ingredients

Here is what you need to have at home.

Ingredient Quantity Unit
red wine 0.75 l
water 0.75 l
cinnamon stick 1 piece
clove 8 pieces
cardamom 8 pieces
brown sugar 3 tsps
orange 0.5 piece
dried plums a handful pieces

Serves: Make sure to share, and buy for your pals.

Preparation

Here are the steps to cook the meal. Takes as long as it takes. Share and enjoy!

  1. Play music in the kitchen. I recommend this playlist.
  2. Pore a glass of drink for the chef.
  3. Start heating up the wine at low heat in a pot.
  4. Crush the cinnamon stick into the wine, and chuck a handful of cloves and cardamom into it. If available, put the spices into a tea infuser.
  5. Zest orange skin, and squeeze the juice of half an orange into the wine.
  6. Stir and add the sugar.
  7. Finally add the plums and water and wait until it heats up again.
  8. Serve into mugs with a few plums.
